Reviews.Title: “Cute, quiet and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: emihole
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a quiet, yet close to the French Quarter, hotel this is the place for you! The rooms are very clean and modern and the staff is friendly and helpful. This hotel doesn't have any fancy amenities, no pool, no downstairs bar, but no fuss! Room Service is available from the neighboring International House. The French Quarter/Bourbon is an easy walking distance and the only noise you will hear at night are few and far between people walking on the street below. They also lock the doors at night with room key only front door access so it's very private. My boyfriend and I stayed here two nights for the Crescent City Classic. My only complaint would be the bathroom and bedroom has very low lighting. It was a little difficult to put on makeup but otherwise this hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at this Very Cool, Modern Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shormk2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Loft 523 for 5 nights during the Final Four. Overall, we had a great experience with the staff- most were very attentive and went out of the way to help us during our time there. The rooms were very sleek, modern, and sexy. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hippest hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: DanDuncan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Loft 523 two weeks ago. We loved it. Not only is it cool but it is in a great location. Just a block from Canal and the French Quarter but QUIET so you can get some rest after all the fun. The hotel is really a loft space. I've lived in lofts before and wish mine were as nice. It is VERY CLEAN and WELL MAINTAINED. The loft was HUGE as well at 600 square feet. The bathroom was spotless, large and the double shower was perfect. You won't find in any other room in NOLA that large without paying suite prices. Speaking of price...it's a bargain for what you get. The staff was very helpful and accomodating as we had weird arrival and departure hours. They made several restaurant recommendations including Jon Besh's Luke which is two blocks away as well as Felix's for the best oysters in town (three blocks away). We have found our new favorite place to stay in New Orleans and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Jerry L
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the hotel. It is a very quiet and quaint hotel with easy access to all the hot areas in New Orleans and the river. It is also really close to the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Great and unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: stjohnond
Reviews.Content: I have been going to New Orleans for many years being a graduate from Tulane University. Through Tablet I got a great rate and with the pictures I decided it would be fun to try when bringing down my girlfriend. All I can say is that I thought this hotel was amazing. It has truly unique decor with terrific contemporary interiors and huge loft style rooms that are true to the name. Being 2 blocks from Canal street its a great location to stay to access the French Quarter, uptown, warehouse district and everything in between. I will definitely make this hotel my go to from now on when visiting.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: joelthevoz
Reviews.Content: After many trips to NOLA, I finally found this gem of a hotel. Not sure how many rooms but guessing 16-24, location is perfect, quiet neighborhood with walking access to the best of the city. Decor is modern, infrastructure is new, service is discreet, beds are comfortable. Will be back in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “A refreshingly modern alternative.”
Reviews.Author: MMPera
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for celebrating our Anniversary - right between the French Quarter and the artsy Warehouse District. Loved the large rooms with high ceilings and modern furnishings + white linens and down pillows on the bed. The bathroom is also very spacious and has a lovely Italian soaking tub. My only complaint is with the dim lighting in the bathroom (obviously designed by a man)...I could barely get my makeup on! The gals working the front desk were very helpful and knowledgeable, especially Stephanie, who is a fount of information on every aspect of New Orleans, particularly the restaurant scene. All in all, a great experience...we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: Jerome H
Reviews.Content: Great amenities, big ceilings, great and welcoming staff. Comforable beds, relatively quiet, and nice interent wif-fi availablility.

Reviews.Title: “Might have a mold problem. Otherwise, fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: brickofcontrol
Reviews.Content: Given the smell of moldy old towels, particularly around the elevator shaft, and the way my allergies would flair just with the couple of minutes in the hall, this place might have a mold problem. No issue in the rooms at least. Hate to post this, as I like the place, but if you've got a bad mold allergy, like I do, beware.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with a fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: AshtonDC
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Loft523 hotel and had an excellent time. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. A shout out to Jeremy and Alexandra. Thank you both for all of help and service. The hotel room was modern and very comfortable. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “NOLA Hotels Got Nuthin' on Loft 523!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gregory69
Reviews.Content: I'm hesitant to write this review for fear of blowing the cover of this inconspicuous, wonderfully-stylish, gem of a boutique hotel. Simply put, for the price you won't find a better stay in all of NOLA... end of story. Visit their site and study the pics featuring clean lines, 21st century hipster sense of interior decorating, giant tubs, unfinished concrete floors, high ceilings and most importantly --elbow room!-- this is EXACTLY what you get folks. It's a hotel room that manages to feel like home the minute you walk in the door. Imminently stylish yet utterly simple and cozy. My girlfriend and I stayed there for three nights in January 2012 and enjoyed every minute...I knew the minute I put the key in the door, that I'd picked the right place for our NOLA adventure-- that's the best feeling in the world when you've just exited a plane and traveled a thousand miles to get there. There's absolutely no question where we are staying the next time we visit New Orleans. A week prior to our arrival, I had reservations at another well-known hotel in the French Quarter. On a whim I called the Loft 523 desk and spoke with Justin about accommodations and things to do in the city. What I received was an utterly authentic, patient and warm breakdown of the unique Loft 523 accommodations as well as local restaurant, music and art recommendations. I canceled my other reservations and booked with the Loft right on the spot. Later in the week, prior to our arrival I had the opportunity to speak with Stephanie and Justin at length about excursions and dining specifics-- they were both incredibly knowledgeable and generous with their time and sharing their personal experiences. Since I hadn't been in the French Quarter in over 25 years, I can't overstate how helpful and welcoming this was. Because of Stephanie and Justin, my girlfriend and I got to experience some much needed R&R, dining at amazing places like Bayona and Muriel's as well as going to some wonderful historic sites. Justin recommended an out-of-the way music venue (the Marigny Opera House) to me on our first night there-- it was probably the highlight of our trip and one of the most romantic, haunting and uniquely New Orleans experiences we had! Unforgettable man! THANK YOU BOTH! (and to Loft management-- these two are the type of team members/staff that bring immeasurable value to your business and will help make Loft 523 one of the most sought-out boutique hotels in NOLA)

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist Decor & Maximalist Service”
Reviews.Author: C R
Reviews.Content: Our new favorite hotel in NOLA. My wife couldn't stop raving about the bath tub, concrete floors and tall ceilings. Great location, decor, and staff. Use of the International House's gym (across the street) was a bonus. We had the best breakfast in years at the restaurant on the corner (Dress It). We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great urban retreat”
Reviews.Author: dan s
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Loft 523 are more like your own studio apartment away from home. The high ceilings, concrete floors, spacious living area, and great walk-in shower in the rooms at this boutique hotel are unique to any other hotel where we've stayed. The location is great, and the Loa Bar at the International House is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: SchulzeM
Reviews.Content: This is by far our favorite hotel in New Orleans. It's very modern and clean design isn't what you would expect from a New Orleans hotel, but it is very well done. The bathtubs are in a teardrop or egg shape and are terrific. The rooms are large - very large - and everything is quality. It's run by the same company that owns the International House, though I like the Loft better. It's in a great location just outside of the french quarter. Parking is the only real pain. There are a few parking garages and lots nearby, a block away, but nothing with the hotel. I greatly recommend it. It's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “25th Anniversary Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Pearl R
Reviews.Content: Our daughter and son-in-law booked us a room with Loft 523 for our 25th wedding anniversary. The rooms are truly unique and very comfortable. The spoon tubs are fantastic. They offer in-room spa services and are truly an upscale hotel. The rooms are very spacious. The hotel is within walking distance to everything. We have never stayed in a boutique hotel but I can say that we really enjoyed the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden little gem”
Reviews.Author: Tabjenn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many great hotels thanks to the reviews on TA, so it's time for me to share as well. My husband and I stayed at Loft 523, what a great place! I don't know how many rooms they actually have, but it's not many. This is truly a boutique hotel. We were on the top floor (which has a wrap around balcony that you share with another room). The bed was super comfortable & the spoon tub was heavenly!! We parked our car Fri afternoon & didn't get back in until Sunday, everything was within walking distance. Without a doubt we will stay again & again & again.

Reviews.Title: “If you like DWELL magazine you'll love Loft523”
Reviews.Author: Mark N
Reviews.Content: I do like Dwell. Staying at Lorft523 is like stepping into it's minimalist pages. Simple, clean lines, tall ceilings, a tasteful touch of repurposed wood generously tiled baths. Great mattresses and feather pillows. And the front desk peeps were awesome. This was my first time back since Katrina. The city and the hotel share this in commonâ€”they're back. I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Cool, contemporary and huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: DiveCaribbean5
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel for people who like contemporary spaces. I stayed at Loft 523 during a conference. It was very walkable to the French Quarter and Convention Center without being in the fray. My room was on the 2nd floor, facing the front and it was huge! Floor to ceiling windows, white furniture and concrete floors. The staff at the front desk were extremely helpful and gave me good tips for jazz lounges and restaurants. My only complaint is that one night I could hear music coming from the bar. If you are a light sleeper, I would request a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place ...cool room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PaulKenny
Reviews.Content: If you are young at heart and want to stay in a v cool and unusual spot then I totally recommend this place. It is near everything and has some really nice design details in the spacious rooms

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gymqwn
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Large clean room, friendly, helpful front desk staff. Great location near the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.....Even better location!”
Reviews.Author: Jeri B
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel tucked away from the craziness of NOLA. Great location central to French Quarter, Garden District and Downtown. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They answered all questions and even helped watch our parking meter while we were out in the quarter. We had great "free" WIFI. Rooms were sleek and clean. Lavatory is phenomenal. Big walk in shower with two shower heads and the huge oval tub was relaxing after a long day in NOLA. I would recommend staying in this hotel and we have already planned our next trip to NOLA and plan to stay at the Loft.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - needs more attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: mr_barbican
Reviews.Content: Excellently located for tourists (5 minutes walk to Bourbon Street), this hotel has so much potential, but lacking the detail one would expect from a hotel marketing itself as a 4.5 star establishment. Great bits: - all staff very friendly, helpful and lovely - large bed, lovely linen - poured concrete floor (cold, but still sexy!) - visually it looked stunning, guests loved it More attention needed: - difficult to find with no external signage (walked past it first time) - needs blackout blinds on windows, it was very light even with the blinds provided - only half of rooms have iPod dock, mine didn't so I had a CD player with a choice of 3 CDs...the cost to provide this in all rooms is minimal. - no hair dryer - 2 shower heads in bathroom cannot be re-angled and are not 4-5 star hotel standard - room not fully clean on arrival (empty packets in cupboards) - lack of minibar or quality room service menu (no beer!) - WIFI link was slow and kept cutting out every 5 minutes (not exaggerating!) - club downstairs wasn't too loud, just a bit rubbish and empty so not worth going

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Cindy H
Reviews.Content: I wish I could find more hotels like this. Beautiful. Quality everything. Very comfortable bed. Completely unique. Looks nothing like the standard room you get at most hotels. Pics can't do it enough justice.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and staff....shame about the club!”
Reviews.Author: Pete-Nnen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at loft 523 for 5 nights with my wife when on a road trip across the southern states. When we arrived we actually walked past the place as there is no sign...but we soon realised our mistake and were welcomed and checked in promptly by the friendly and helpful member of staff. The room...was huge and very minimal as per the photos on the website. We loved this as it was so hot outside the room was a cool haven away from the hustle and bustle of NOLA. It had all the facilities detailed on the website in terms of cable TV, iPod Dock, Wifi, etc. The staff...were always helpful and willing to advise on where to go and what to do as well as providing extra coffee when our was not refreshed. However be sure to hang the do not disturb sign as we had the cleaner knocking at 8am on our first morning. The club...this is actually opposite reception and the hotel lobby is open with the club at one end. The music and base starts kicking at about 10pm and goes on until 3am. We had a room on the second floor above the club and we could feel the vibrations! This along with everyone talking\shouting outside certainly kept us awake. The rooms are only single glazed so it was like all the people outside were in our room with us! The club is only open 3 nights a week, so if you are not staying on these nights you would be ok. The maintenance...overall the rooms are nice but there was a few minor points. The ventilation in the bathroom did not appear to work...in fact it was just a hole in the plasterboard ceiling where I assume a grate of some kind should have been. There was another small hole in the wall where I assume a towel hook once was. The shower also had mould in it, which is not expected at this price range. Whilst on the shower it actually had two shower heads on different walls which gave a really narrow angle of spray...it looked good, but not the most practical! Overall...nice big rooms and friendly staff, but the noise from the club and street means that I certainly would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back, this is the only place I'll stay while in THE NOLA!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 48LAWS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the International House I love that hotel also.... But its just the feel and the space of the room of LOFT 523 that made it worth every dollar, I will be back for the Jay-Z and Kanye West concert.......and not to mention the prime location, the staff was the best keep up the good work , ya heard me!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: stephanie j
Reviews.Content: Loft 523 is a unique and stylish hotel that I will recommend to all my friends and family. I found this through a search for hotels in New Orleans and my search now ends at Loft 523. I was very impressed with my stay. The staff was beyond friendly and very professional. My room was very clean and I felt right at home. The beds are comfy and the spoon tub is to die for. Blocks away from local bars, eateries, and main attractions. I will only stay when I visit NOLA. The lounge next door was very nice also..

Reviews.Title: “So Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Atlantagirl67
Reviews.Content: Love Love Love this swanky little hotel. The room was amazing and the showers, to die for. The location was so great we did not move the car until it was time to leave. The staff was so nice and informative, thanks for suggestion of the Ruby Slipper for breakfast, so good. We will surely be back and we will recommend you to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loft 523”
Reviews.Author: polarbear27
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay, but definatley need ear muffs if you are not nightclubing, very handy and near the French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “Lots to like about this place, BUT....”
Reviews.Author: LynnLasVegas
Reviews.Content: If you like sleek, small boutique hotels, ones that go against the grain of the large mega-hotels that you find in many cities, there's a lot to like about Loft 523. The first is it's location. Only two blocks from the French Quarter, the location couldn't have been more perfect for us. We were close to the action, but not in the thick of it, which is exactly what we wanted. We were also within walking distance of some great restaurants, including Herbsaint on St. Charles, which I highly recommend, and we were able to walk from the Garden District back to the hotel one afternoon. Again, the location was a big plus for us. The second is the size and look of the rooms. We had the deluxe room, which had huge windows and a high ceiling, concrete floors and a really nice, lofty feeling that we loved. Our bed was super comfy and the music system was very cool (bring an IPOD, if you have one). And our shower, with dual shower heads, was massive. The third aspect, which is always a big plus, was cleanliness. Our room was spotless and housekeeping did a great job everyday. The downside - and for me this is a big one - was noise. Like many other reviewers noted, there is a club on the ground floor of the hotel, right off the lobby that's open several days a week, including weekends. Our room was on the fourth floor, but we could still hear the music and feel the thump of the bass into the wee hours of the morning. We could also hear noise from those who had stepped outside to smoke. Luckily, I had read reviews that mentioned the noise issue before heading to NOLA, so I brought ear plugs with me; and I'm glad I did. I used them two out of the three nights we were there. But, honestly, who wants to put in ear plugs when you're paying $130+ a night for a room? It was manageable, but certainly not ideal. And given just how small the hotel is (18 rooms) the music and noise has no place to go but up to the rooms, which is too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Groovy room but staff let it down sometimes”
Reviews.Author: Saphira07
Reviews.Content: Mid week stay in in the 'noisy room' which was not too bad as the bar was only opened for one of the nights for what seemed a private party - noise that night could be heard but not too bad if you go out yourself plus note Arlin the Courbet still honoured our $50 bar tab which was good as hotel bar not available. Staff unfortunately did sometimes seem a tad disinterested in clients except for last day for lady - sorry did not get you name who helped with taxi and bags on our departure.

Reviews.Title: “No problem with noise, good stay”
Reviews.Author: SarahChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: The reviews are correct in that the club downstairs is bumping late at night, but I requested a room on the top floor and neither my friend or I noticed the noise at all when we were in our room. Granted - we both live in the city and are used to sleeping through city noise. I liked the location and the ambience. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it & we definitely will be back.....”
Reviews.Author: whitneynolagirl
Reviews.Content: Service received was above what was expected,,staff was knowledgable about area,restaurants & very helpful with request.. hotel was very romantic & sheek, bring bubble bath awsome tub.... ....... areunvus@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: WilliamW8
Reviews.Content: This is really a cool place, with great rooms and bathrooms large and awesome. Stayed here a few times, but will have to strongly reconsider next time. The "music system" was broken and dirty in all of the rooms we stayed in (we moved at least twice). The little things have not had attention paid to them - the sort of things that are easy to do, like remotes that work and things being clean. The real issue here is noise. This place is tucked away on a side street that seems like the perfect place to get away. But the nightclub below is preposterously loud, and goes on for the better part of the night. You cannot sleep, even after being out yourself and being tired. There were no rooms we moved to that didn't vibrate with a constant base that couldn't be covered up, even with earplugs. We were moved to the top far end of the hotel and still heard and felt it.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest hotel I've ever been able to afford!”
Reviews.Author: PuggleMaster3000
Reviews.Content: I'm a budget traveler for sure. So when I found a great deal on the stylish-looking Loft 523, I was pretty excited for a change of pace from the usual type of hotel I stay in (the kind where you try to spend as little time as possible in the room). My hubby and I loved New Orleans and we loved this hotel. It was located within walking distance from the bus stop (we took the public bus from the airport). We were able to check in at about 10:30am after our red-eye flight from CA. We immediately loved the concrete floors and modern furniture. Later that night, about 1am, after returning from partying in the French Quarter, we discovered why they call it the "We Will Rock You" room - the noisy bar below was indeed noisy. But guess what? When we discovered the I-pod dock next to the flat-screen TV, we suddenly didn't care anymore. The speakers ROCKED, i think there was even a subwoofer! We played our tunes over the noise of the bar and had a blast. We were so sad to check out. This place even SMELLED good. I could live there! The staff was very polite and helpful. Our only slightly negative experience was the second night when we visited the attached bar, LePhare, to use the credit they gave us (I am guessing they give the "We Will Rock You" guests bar credit so they don't complain about the noise from the bar below). The manager kept making us move (3 times) so he could accomodate other parties. We asked how many times we would be asked to move and he gave us some attitude. But whatever, free drinks, so how can I complain (although I'm sure that's what he was thinking too). Go, enjoy, soak it up! This place rocks.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! Modern and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Lindsayecollins
Reviews.Content: I have nothing to but great things to say about this hotel for a couple coming down for a weekend in New Orleans. The modern rooms are great, very sleek, with an amazing bathroom. The room is affordable, but still quite large. Ours came with a patio which was nice. There is a loud nightclub in the lobby, but we couldn't hear it, I think it only affects one room so make sure to ask not for that one. Also, you're in New Orleans for fun anyways so who cares! Anyways, spend your money on booze and food and stay in this great little boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but good things to say about Loft 523”
Reviews.Author: dan_in_colorado
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a business trip I had to NOLA and after reading reviews was a little hesitant to see what my experience would bring. I am pleased to say that I had a great stay. I was on the third floor and was blown away by the size of the room. The Whole Foods snack options were great. The front desk was always helpful and pleasant. I never heard this night club that folks complain about. The Aveda products were also a nice touch. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great, contemp flavor; noise no prob; $50 bar tab disingenuous.”
Reviews.Author: loukahn
Reviews.Content: We took the "Rock Star" room (#2B, room above the bar) with discounted rate + $50 bar tab however, we were there Wed. night to Sunday and the bar was not open at all except starting around 9-10PM on Fri and Sat nights only; The opportunity we had to get in the bar late one night, the deafening base was too uncomfortable for us oldsters but fortunately up in our room the noise was nicely muffled and we slept soundly. We were surprised the bar was never open for Happy Hour; We wanted to bring friends by were discouraged that the bar was not open. All that said the place has a great contemp feel with minor maintenance issues (light burnt out, robe hook broken); It does seem like they keep a skeleton crew there but Devon, on loan one day from the Int. House, was great with attention, advice, and recs. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disrespectful Manager”
Reviews.Author: michael3138
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Loft 523 on Thursday, May 5, 2011 and had a terrible experience in Room 2D. When I brought it up to the customer service manager Amiee Foret was extremely insulting with the way she handled the situation. To share with you the details of what occurred with my stay the shower in 2D apparently had a defect in it which caused the water to leak from the bathroom to the sleeping quarters in a short period of time. I ran the shower for less than four minutes so that the water could get hot and noticed that the water was leaking from the shower area to the sleeping quarters. At that point I placed towels throughout the floor to soak up the water. Unfortunately, I had my tan leather computer bag to the right of the bed where it was damaged. I immediately called the front desk and the overnight front desk receptionist was clueless on what to do. She attempted to call maintenance but they were not available at 11:30 p.m. so I suggested if she could provide me with another room. At that point she checked me into the room across the hall which was 2E. I was extremely surprised that no one offered to assist me with moving my belongings from 2D to 2E. On Friday morning as I was checking out I voiced my complaint to the front desk hostess and she immediately called Amiee Foret. Amiee was very nonchalant, I informed Amiee that I have pictures to show the damage that was caused to the room and I can show her the damage that was done to my bag and I asked her if she can come to loft 523 and I can show her what took place. Her statement was to me was why would I let the shower run for 4 minutes? I explained to her that I was waiting for the water to get hot and I didnâ€™t realize the water was leaking into the bedroom while I was shaving. Her statement was to me that that really doesnâ€™t make any sense but she will have maintenance come and check it out. Once we disconnected from the phone call I spoke with the front desk associate, showed her the pictures and she advised me since Amiee refused to come to Loft 523 that I should walk to the International House where she is located and show her the pictures, so that is what I did. It took Aimee over 20 minutes to come out once I asked for her at the front desk, and when she arrived she was extremely rude and very reluctantly looked at the pictures that were taken on my phone. At this point she stated to me that maintenance was in the room and they did not see a problem, which made me extremely upset because she indirectly was calling me a liar. I asked if I could meet maintenance in the room because I was truly upset with this statement and I refused to be called a liar. At this point I walked with the head of maintenance and when I arrived to Loft 523 the maintenance associate checked the wrong room, he checked 2E instead of 2D. At this point I was extremely upset but myself and the maintenance associate walked into 2D turned the shower on and within 2 minutes the bathroom started flooding and it leaked into the bedroom. Maintenance then contacted Aimee and asked her to take care of this situation for me and advised me to walk back to the International House to resolve this matter. When I went back into the International House it took Aimee over 15 minutes to come and speak with me. Once she arrived Aimee stated that she will reduce the room rate by half. I explained to Aimee at this point reducing the room rate by half is completely unacceptable. Her statement to me was that she does not understand why this is unacceptable. I explained to Aimee that she has held me up for over an hour and a half to prove my case in addition I had to move into another room in the middle of the night and my bag was damaged not to mention she indirectly called me a liar. At this point she reluctantly informed me that there would be no charge for my stay. I really enjoy staying at Loft 523 but I refuse to be treated in this manner.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, contemporary place”
Reviews.Author: pavance1
Reviews.Content: Mod, minimalist space in a great location near the Quarter and the Warehouse district. The place has a cool nightclub and the staff were just extraordinarily helpful and friendly. The outside noise was a bit loud as there was a movie filmcrew working just outside our room. A nice sound system in the room, but no alarm clock...we did have just the basic room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kramerio
Reviews.Content: Huge room - Very nice design. Staff at the desk were not very reliable - forgot my wake up call both days I was there - but all friendly and helpful. Was very quiet (but club downstairs was closed both nights I was there - not sure what it is like when the club is open). Water pressure in shower is too weak, but otherwise the bathroom is great with a large, soaking tub. In general, I was very impressed and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is where you want to be after a day in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Dor421
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the French Quarter Festival. It was everything I was looking for. Very cool design elements and a large spacious living area. The built-in speakers complemented the music we brought with us. And the Italian designed soaking tub was a welcome indulgence after a full day of music and dancing. The staff was friendly and always helpful. The bar was also very hip and a great place to come back to for more night life.

Reviews.Title: “stylish, spacious and best of all, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: eastvancity
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the 523 property while in NO for a conference. My room was modern, stylishly appointed, spacious and most importantly, comfortable - a quality achieved by a rare few hotels. What truly set my experience apart was the quality of the staff at 523 and its sister property, International House Hotel. Over the course of my 5 days in NO, the day and night staff at 523 and the stellar concierge at International House (just round the corner) repeatedly pointed me in the right direction, whether it be fantastic music spots on Frenchman st, 'must go' dining spots in the french quarter and treme, or more close to home, the fantastic Loa lounge at IH Hotel. All of the recommendations were seriously on point, amounting to a very memorable stay while in NO. I travel frequently and found my stay at Loft 523 to be one of the best, if not the outright best, work/travel experience to date. The hotel has character and the staff are truly first class. Well done, all around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: timlobello4
Reviews.Content: Great central location. Amazing modern design inside and understated outside. Small, cozy environment gives you more a feeling of staying in an apartment than a hotel. Very good value and the staff was fantastic - more friendly and helpful than I've ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time & HOTEL In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: erinne_smith
Reviews.Content: The front desk is Great!!! The hotel Rooms are contemporary and so close to everything you want to experience in New Orleans. From Jazz to great restuarants and fabulous lounges they are all within walking distance or a short cab ride. Whether you want to see the french quarter or go to Bourbon...it's all right there! I've stayed in the Loft as well as the Penthouse suite and all I can say is I Cant Wait to Return. They offer an elegantly private get away if you are with your girlfriends or that special someone this is the place to be.They also offer a lounge downstairs with great drinks and a DJ that somehow doesnt effect the personal time you spend in the room. Not overpriced and an overall great New Orleans stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in new orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly1984
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very contemporary and was suited to my age range. It was in a great location for easy access to shopping and partying. The staff was very nice and very helpful with directions. The check in and check out was very quick and easy. It was great that they had valet and they came parked and brought back my car quick. It was very helpful to have that. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are especially nice and comfortable. Everyone should try out the loft and its sister hotel the international house. You will be very happy that you did!

Reviews.Title: “The SOHO of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: MrTokinBlackGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed during the busiest time of New Orleans. "Mardi Gras". Let me tell you it was THE perfect idea setting for me. I was in the heart of Downtown New Orleans, where literally everything was in walking distance. Bourbon Street was 5 minutes away from. The casino was 2 and the river was 5 mins. I read other reviews that the club downstairs was too loud. In fact when I was there, the only thing that was loud was the people yelling from partying too much. Overall the place was very nice. It's very trendy. The bathroom was nice with 2 shower heads and a huge tub. The bed was nice and cozy and the living room area was spacious. When I come back to New Orleans, I only want to stay here. I look forward to coming back and enjoying my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: thorhansen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It did take some googling before deciding to book here due to quite a few poor reviews in regards to noise, but no regrets for doing so. There is some noise from the club on the ground floor, but we had rooms on third and fourth floor, so it was not so bad. We had both A and B rooms facing Gravier street, and D and E rooms further back in the hotel. The latter are preferable due to quite a bit of noise from the street, especially from people standing outside the club smoking and yelling. But really no problem unless you are a light sleeper. The modern contemporary design of the rooms is hard to come by in New Orleans, and it is really clean and trendy. I love the place, and will definately be back soon. Only a few minutes walking distance from French quarters, Bourbon street, the Mississippi, Harrahs casino +++

Reviews.Title: “Loft is Loud”
Reviews.Author: leotraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a good location if you want to party and don't mind sleeping above a nightclub. If you want a restful night's sleep then look elsewhere. The rooms are spacious but the shower water pressure is lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Really good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: aploj
Reviews.Content: It has modern ample rooms, very clean and good service (boutique style). recommended for those that do not want to stay in the french quarter, but would like to be 5 min walking distance and like small hotels

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel - Exactly what i was looking for..”
Reviews.Author: Orinyc
Reviews.Content: Staff was super friendly and helpful. Wanted to stay a bit off the "big hotel grid" and Loft 523 was my ticket. Had a room on the 3rd floor, it was huge, modern and very very loft like. Bed was super comfortable, had a docking station for my iphone, fast free internet, dual shower heads, excellent design. Perfectly located ( right off canal ) on a quite street (gravier ) - Definitely a must stay if your into boutique hotels..

Reviews.Title: “This is not a full service hotel.”
Reviews.Author: milotravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a prebirthday celebration during January 2011. I made SURE to get a room on the 4th floor in order to avoid the noise from the club downstairs. I should have also requested the back of the building. Even from the 4th floor, the thumping music can be heard. The staff consists of one person per shift that watches over the lobby. Every single time we walked through the lobby the "personal assistant" had ear buds in. It seemed futile to try to talk to a person with ear buds in. The decor is minimalistic, modern and very well thought out, but I think thats where the planning stopped. There is a definite odor in the hallways and lobby. I understand old buildings have issues, but inscense is NOT the answer. The smell when you arrive is sickenly sweet. The room, however, was odor free. Shower was equipped with two heads, and great tile, but no water pressure. There was not a soda machine on the property. I was told to "go to the restaurant on the corner." If you drive, be prepared for $30 daily valet. It cant be avoided. Good points: The location is awesome. The beds are comfy. The decor is cool and trendy. The electronics in the room are new and modern. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to a young crowd. If you need a full service hotel : (room service, ice buckets, a cocktail at 5 pm) skip it and stay at the sister property, the International House.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel with attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Loft 523 on a trip to NOLA for the Po Boy Fest. We loved every detail of our loft and were blown away by the size and sleek decor. Upon entry through a hammered copper door, we saw the large bathroom complete with a super-mod Italian tub. The bedroom had a king bed on one side and a sitting area with a separate space for the desk on the other side. Just when we thought this loft could not get any more spacious, we saw a door that lead out to a private patio area. We usually frequent Starwood hotels when we travel and this boutique hotel ranks right up there (or exceeds) any of the places we have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Are you hipster enough to stay here? Probably not.”
Reviews.Author: anthrojason
Reviews.Content: Pros: *Rooms are BIG, modern and clean *Staff is very friendly and welcoming *Very comfortable bed and furniture in the room. Cons: *I felt like I was not hip or cool enough to stay here. There is definitely a hipster vibe. *Lobby and elevator smell... bad. They burn incense 24/7 to try and cover the smell, but that just ends up smelling like incense and mold. *Room we were given on first night had not been cleaned. Only other room left was the "rock you" room. The sounds was incredibly loud. To the point where the whole bed vibrated until about 4am. Zero sleep. Complained the next morning and were moved. However, was not refunded the difference in price of the room which was about $60 less than the one we booked. *The shower is, at best, like two guys peeing on you. Probably the worst shower I have ever had in a hotel and I've stayed at some shoddy places across the globe. I never felt clean the whole time I was there. *The free wifi didn't work the first or last day there and when it did work, it was SLOOOOOW. On balance, I would not stay here again and wouldn't recommend it. There are to many other similarly priced nice places close by that have better amenities and less noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MontyWarren
Reviews.Content: If you like Frank Lloyd Wright architecture, you will love this place. The location is great for business and pleasure and the people are very friendly and helpful. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Super cool Hotel with Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: ModernTraveler10
Reviews.Content: stayed here last week for 3 nights booked directly thru the front desk. kind enough to upgrade our room. room was roomy and modern/loft style. very unique. front desk staff was very good to excellent. lobby and elevator had a mold smell. the club on the weekend was a bit loud. I would suggest staying here if loft hotel stay is your thing. the location is great, close to everything and not smack in the middle of the French Quarter, a short 2 block walk.

Reviews.Title: “Independent hotel without the "Indier-than-thou" feeling”
Reviews.Author: Magellantx
Reviews.Content: I imagine finding a gem is similar--something off the beaten path, where the shadows from the Marriotts and Omni's fall but can't enter the door of this lovely boutique. I didn't tour the hotel so I can't speak for all the rooms--but mine featured a cool tub, lots of space, very little in the way of furniture beyond a nice bed, a desk and a sofa (of sorts) from which to entertain. In a city that takes Ann Rice too seriously, the gem is flawed in all the right places, with a non-descript street presence that hides a wonderful stay. The bar is simple and sleek and I honestly can't complain about one thing in the hotel--other reviews refer to the bar's ovewhelming sound but that was not my experience, located 3 floors up... The staff is young and pleasant and I struggle to find a comparison for Loft 523--the hotel is elegant without any pretense at all, as like a Fellini documentary on making a simple pot of coffee. Ok, so yeah, he never did that, but if he did, you can be sure it would be served and served well, in this lovely, simple boutique.

Reviews.Title: “A Cool Hotel in a Cool City”
Reviews.Author: thoelena
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at the Loft 523 Hotel for a wedding. It was a FABULOUS stay! Our deluxe room was above Le Phare, although it's a nightclub and it doesn't open until 9 or 10PM, the noise level didn't bother us (what noise level? We were out all night). The hotel even offered us a $50 drink coupon for the bar, which we were unable to use. On a recent stay in New Orleans we stayed at the sister hotel, International House, around the corner. If the $50 Le Phare drink coupon could be used at that bar as well, I would rate this tops all the way! Essentially the front desk help is super nice, helpful and friendly. They are young and hip and look great in those uniforms ;-) Our room was amazingly roomy, with tons of sunlight, and one of the most comfortable beds I have ever had in a hotel room. Although our bathroom had no tub, the shower was big enough for 2 and nicely laid out. Loft 523 is in a GREAT location, it's so close to the French Quarter and so close to the uptown bus on Magazine Street. I went to Tulane so I lived in this great city for 5 years - I wish the Loft 523 were around back then because I would've had all my family and friends stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: rzrbmp
Reviews.Content: I booked Loft 523 for my husbands birthday weekend. We are frequent travelers to New Orleans and are always looking for a hotel that sets the tone for the stay. We both loved this hotel. It is a great place for both a chic young crowd and older people that like to feel like they are still in the mix. The rooms are large and very modern. i am a fan of modern art and architecture so I was really excited to see the room decor. The staff could not do enough for us. They made us feel very welcome from the moment we arrived. The bar opens at about 10 p.m. They had fantastic music and talented bartenders. i am sure to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern Lofts with Swank”
Reviews.Author: Getwhatchapaid4
Reviews.Content: Best place for the space, location, and decor. Love the ultra modern electronics and warehouse feel. The only place I will stay in NOLA. The lounge is a cool spot where there is a nice scene for the beautiful people in New Orleans. It is walking distance to the convention center and to Bourbon St. Loved It.

Reviews.Title: “Best NOLA hotel”
Reviews.Author: Honeybee2121
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the early 2000s and had a wonderful experience as was heartbroken when it closed down post-Katrina. Now, I'm happy to report this chic, fun loft hotel is back and better than ever. I particularly love the spoon bathtubs (a feature that makes upgrading to a superior room very worth it). This place is a great bargain compared to nearby CBD hotels, and I highly recommend staying here. Great staff, clean and amazing space. Comfy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Do it”
Reviews.Author: Star2
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here if you require any sleep at all during the night.This was the loudest hotel we have ever stayed in.Besides the nightclub that ROCKS all night long,we had someone over us walking all day and all night,toilets flushing,doors slamming,people yelling,horns honking. The rooms are certainly showing their age and not all parts were in working order.Lightbulbs out,ceiling fan not working,speakers on surround sound didnt work,carpeting frayed.The beds were on the floor and difficult to get out of unless you roll out of the side onto your knees and then stand.Seriously. I get what they were trying to do here but they didnt execute the design. The People at the desk were nice and pleasant but we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL SERVICE AND AWFUL POLICY”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter013
Reviews.Content: I'm going to start with the policy, so when you book there are three choices of rooms, superior deluxe, deluxe and we will rock you, which means you are above the club and it is loud, I booked months in advance and got a better rate than most people in the hotel and booked the deluxe room which is the middle rate. I was put in a we will rock you room because I had the lowest rate of the other guests who booked the deluxe rooms, so because I was first and lowest I got bumped because when they get a busy weekend the deluxe room on the we will rock you floor becomes a deluxe room magically. There isn't anywhere on the website that warns you of this. Since it is such a busy weekend there is no where else to go and you just have to deal with it so they can get away with it. This is not a way to treat people. Also the kid and I stress kid at the desk was not nice and acted as though we were bothering him and you could see it in his face that he did not want to deal with us. The structure of the hotel is cool and the room is cool but if you come to New Orleans on a busy weekend do not book this hotel unless you pay the highest rate you might get rocked all night long!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep, go somewhere else. If you want to party all night, this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: rcurtis948
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our early 60s, and chose this hotel based on a recommendation from a friend of a friend. We had a spacious, modern room, purposefully booked on the fourth floor, knowing that the club off the lobby would probably disturb us a little bit. When the party overflowed onto the street that night, and the music got turned up louder, we were in agony. Until 3:00 am. Then, the next night (Sunday) promised more of the same, but ended a little earlier. I'm checking out today and finding another place. Never again. BTW, the hotel clerk says he's tried to tell the owner about the constant noise complaints, and the owner won't listen to him. We couldn't even get a light bulb for the reading lamp higher than 40 watts, so I can't even read through all the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotle in Unique city!!!”
Reviews.Author: Splendora
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I live in New Orleans and we've been hearing so many good things about this unique hotel, so we decided to stay a night, just for fun. We discovered a modern and hip marvel in a nostalgic city, a true gem in the heart of New Orleans. Its refreshing to see a hotel in this city that goes out of its way to provide a "wow" experience- the front desk is super friendly and really helpful. All in all, we had a great time on our local vacation- GREAT JOB!!! Thanks so much, Lee Kyle

Reviews.Title: “Care for some bass with your sleep?”
Reviews.Author: RenzoSB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on Thursday & Friday. We were supposed to stay there for Saturday night as well, but you'll soon find out why we bailed. We booked this hotel after reading all of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. I pre-paid on neworleansonline.com because I received a better rate than booking straight through the hotel. I had paid for a superior room, but when we checked in, we were pleasantly surprised to get a deluxe superior room with the stone tub. The only caveat was that we were put on the 2nd floor. When I had called a week earlier to confirm my reservation, I was told that we'd be on the third floor. The reception guy told me that they were all booked and could only accomadate me on the 2nd floor, and assured me that the room is away from the club on the 2nd floor and should not hear "a thing". If you're on the 2nd floor (anywhere on the 2nd floor), then you're pretty much screwed because of the club downstairs. I mean, you can pretty much sing along to all the songs because you can practically hear EVERYTHING that is happening downstairs. As we were trying to sleep, we could hear/feel the bass through the pillows. The whole room was vibrating with bass. It wasn't so bad on Thursday night, but on Friday, it was ridiculous. Who thought that it'd be a good idea to build a loft hotel on top of a club?!? On Saturday morning, we went down to reception to ask for a room change, something above the second floor. We had to wake up really early for a 6am flight on Sunday morning, so a good night's rest was much needed. Reception told us that they were fully booked and were unable to honor our request for a room change. However, they did offer to discount our rate, which would have been great had we not pre-paid through neworleansonline.com. They did say that a standard room at their sister hotel, The International House, was available to us should we decide to move. Yes, of course, we wanted to move! We didn't want to listen to the "I Love Big Butts...." song AGAIN!! The International House Hotel is just a block away, so it wasn't that big of an inconvenience to schlep our stuff around. The room over there was much smaller, but we really didn't care. Other than the sound issue, the room at Loft 523 was impressive. If you love contemporary style, then this is the place for you. If you plan on actually sleeping, then request a room above the 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Cool”
Reviews.Author: JRF1702
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stumbled onto Loft 523 through an internet search. While in New Orleans staying at another hotel, we went by to have a look. The hard part is finding the hotel even though it is very conveniently located just off Canal Street and easy walking distance to the French Quarter. The entrance is a nondescript door in a warehouse district that also is home to August restaurant. But once inside, you are immediately aware that Loft 523 is going to be unique. I asked to see a room and was shown two. The ultimate in trendy chic. Concrete floors, large minimally furnished rooms with tall ceilings accentuated by a wonderful low bed. Very modern but with old warehouse features like exposed brick walls (real) and massive support columns. I booked two rooms following the tour and along with another couple, we spent a great weekend at this trendy, reasonably priced gem. There is no restaurant, but in a city surrounded by dining opportunities, who cares.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Mac, Not a PC...”
Reviews.Author: Ellison72
Reviews.Content: Loft 523 is, as all of the other reviews suggest, a high concept, design-driven space. There are thousands of details that gave the entire hotel a modern elegance: the tin-stamped roofing sheets in the elevator, the hammered copper doors to the rooms, the lighting design within the rooms themselves. If you are a fan of contemporary design, this is your hotel. What the prior reviews may not mention is that the stark, angular design belies a remarkably comfortable space. The staff were warm and welcoming from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. They were fantastic with recommendations, helpful, and genuinely warm. On a whim, we asked to see the Penthouse, and we were just handed a key. We stayed in a superior loft and were fairly stunned by the size of the space. There is a huge amount of room. As others have noted, the bathrooms were amazing. The tubs (pictured) really are extraordinary. We recommend that you don't take a bath if you are truly interested in NOT being converted to the merits of a ridiculously expensive tub. We've both had apartments that were smaller than the bathroom in our room. Did anyone mention the memory foam mattresses? That was some good sleepin'. We were on the 4th floor on the backside of the hotel. We heard zero noise even though we were there on "Russian Night" at the club. It is, likely, a good thing that we were not subject to bad Euro-techno at all hours. In sum, we would recommend Loft 523 to anyone with a contemporary aesthetic who would like to be in a beautiful space. Hotel rooms, like computers, all do the same things. You might as well pick a beautiful one.

Reviews.Title: “Style, Location, Service - Wow!”
Reviews.Author: siasam
Reviews.Content: Loft 523 is the sister Hotel to the International house. As the name implies the rooms have the feel of a stylish loft. The staff, as at the International House, seem to really want to be helpful and friendly - and they are! The rooms vary from good to very very good - with modern tubs, stonework and furnishings designed to make you feel both comfortable and stylish. The location is perhaps the best part - you can easily walk to many great locals without the hassles/noise of being directly in Quarter. You also feel like you are staying at a hotel that is part of the NOLA scene, not just another generic hotel. I strongly recommend Loft 523 and its sister hotel The International House as two wondeful places to stay in NOLA. I would

Reviews.Title: “Lobby was noisy, room was great.”
Reviews.Author: NOLATraveler9
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for the Superbowl. Was in 3E. Room was great, staff was as well. No noise issues in the room, lobby and elevator were noisy though. I can see how people on the second floor, or even the third floor right over the club, would have noise issues though, so be sure to call in advance to request something away from the club.

Reviews.Title: “modern gem in warehouse district”
Reviews.Author: sirreel
Reviews.Content: excellent 2 night stay. we were surprised with an upgrade to the penthouse. a very large room with a larger wrap around deck. staff all helpful and friendly. had heard that bar noise could be a problem and it was not. would surely stay again. great not being right in french quarter....and near outstanding warehouse restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: swaeri
Reviews.Content: I'll definitely stay here again. We reserved room for $159 and asked for the 4th floor to avoid the noise and were upgraded to a very large room with one of the tubs. The place is like having your own condo in the Central Business District. We only saw 2 or 3 other couples the whole time we were there. You're one block from the St. Charles trolley car line and one block from the Magazine Street bus. It's only 3-4 blocks from the French Quarter, great location. If you like contemporary design, the place is for you. The tub was fantastic, all limestone bathroom, Aveda products. Bring you own CD and movies, as the room has a little audio/video system. The bar down stairs (LePhare) was happening, but we never heard the noise on the 4th floor. We caught a show at House of Blues, which is close and ate at MiLa, 4 blocks away and it was one of the best meals I have ever had in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra contemporary hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: mhbytb
Reviews.Content: If you love good design, you'll love this hotel. Great location in the warehouse/arts district. A great benefit is that you also have some privileges at their sister hotel across the street - iHotel. Staff could not have been more helpful. I can't wait for my next visit! Marcy Hart Dallas, TX

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room, perfect location perfect everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chefnosaj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a narrow downtown street next to other hotels but you would never know it! This is a one of a kind experience.... probably not for everyone however if you are looking for a hotel that is chic, modern & close to everything you want to see and do in New Orleans then this is for you. The rooms are huge. The bed is comfortable and the batrooms is jaw dropping with its tub & double headed shower. The Lounge La Phare downstairs was a little bit loud but not after 1 am or so... We were never in bed this early and the one night we were... I just passed out anyway. And BTW i was on the 2nd floor. I would recomend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience the nighlife in New Orleans and wants to be just far enough away to escape it when you want and still be close enough to be right in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Cool rooms but very loud bar”
Reviews.Author: Miloman10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Loft 523 for a business/pleasure trip. I arrived on a Wed. and stayed through Sunday. The hotel is in a great location and on a quiet side street. The front desk folks are very helpful and considerate, especially Greg. They go out of their way to make suggestions and give directions. I was disappointed, however, to get a room on the 2nd floor b/c I was concerned, from reading trip advisor, about the noise from the bar. There was no flexibility b/c I needed a room with a tub, since my partner who would be joining me for the weekend, had foot surgery and could not get her foot wet. This also cost me an extra $40 a night, $200 for the stay, to get a room with a tub. This tub is supposed to be great, and it does look cool, however, it's not contoured to the human body. In other words, it's pretty, but not very functional. The room itself, was huge, with high ceilings and concrete floors, very modern. So, to the noise issue. Believe the reviews, the noise is a big deal, if you plan to go to sleep before 2:15 a.m. The downstairs bar has a dj, from Thurs. through Sunday nights. Their specialty must be techno b/c the vibrations from the thumping bass sound kept me awake for 3 of the 4 dj nights. Unbelievable. I had to get drunk, the one night, just to sleep. I asked to be moved, but they couldn't accomodate me, b/c of this tub issue, and b/c they had to take in guests from their sister hotel, The International House. This hotel has only 18 rooms, 2 of which are penthouse suites. So, they cannot be very flexible in shifting folks around. I thought they should have at least reduced my rate by the extra $40 a night for the "deluxe" tub, since I spent 3 nights just walking around our room, praying I didn't run out of beer. This hotel is super cool and modern, and Greg and the other front desk folks are so nice, but the noise/vibration would be a deal breaker for me.

Reviews.Title: “looks good, sleeps bad”
Reviews.Author: traveler3142
Reviews.Content: Loft 523 has great, urban-looking rooms: modern decor, high ceilings, platform beds. But there are a few basic things I expect from even the cheapest hotel: cleanliness, hot water and a relatively quiet room. Loft 523 fails miserably on the last count. As other reviewers mentioned, the downstairs nightclub is a serious problem. (This is not a "bar," as advertised on their web site.) We're not talking a little music vibrating through the floors; we're talking serious noise, especially when drunken patrons drift onto the sidewalk and start shouting at 2 a.m. The desk clerk told me that the hotel doesn't manage the club (great planning, guys!) and has no control over the noise. Why the rooms weren't designed with soundproof windows is beyond me. You cannot sleep well here. The desk clerk offered us earplugs too, which just doesn't cut it from a good customer service perspective. We switched hotels after the first night. Seriously, for the rates Loft 523 charges, the noise is just unacceptable. At $200ish a night, it seems reasonable to be able to get a decent night's sleep. It made me feel like I was back in a $15 a night hostel on some rowdy town square in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Cool space, loud night club, a few wrinkles to work out”
Reviews.Author: tiger_jenn
Reviews.Content: We were really excited to stay at this hotel because of its visual appeal. It did not disappoint there. However, it seems that this is a cool concept that has a few wrinkles to be ironed out, as well as a VERY LOUD nightclub adjacent to the lobby. We arrived too early for check-in, so we left our bags. When we came back to get our room key, we assumed our bags would be in our room. They weren't. And the phone didn't work, so we had to go back downstairs. Then, it took a VERY long time for the water to turn warm (it never got beyond warm no matter how long I ran it). But at least it was warm enough that I didn't have to take a cold bath (the tub was worth the upgrade to the deluxe room). The maintenance staff leaves at 8 p.m., and I discovered the water temp thing at 9. The bed was comfortable, and I was sleeping well until about 2 a.m., when the night club downstairs became REALLY loud. This went on until 3:30 or so, when a few people carried the party out into the street after the nightclub closed. The woman at the front desk said that she gets complaints from every floor about the noise and handed me ear plugs. I just wish they'd been in the room and I hadn't had to get dressed to go downstairs to get them. It's a really cool looking hotel great for people who want to be out enjoying New Orleans' night life. But don't stay here if you need to be up early and want to get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Loft 523 - well worth a try”
Reviews.Author: bc_sanjose
Reviews.Content: I chose Loft 523 for a recent 4-night stay in NOLA and came away very impressed. The 400-sq-ft rooms are tastefully furnished and we found ourselves staying in much more than we would have if we had been in a typical hotel room. Space is great! The hotel lacks amenities, but they're up front about this, so I knew what we'd be getting. My one strong recommendation is that you ask for a room in the back of the hotel, i.e., not one facing Gravier St. The nightclub downstairs (Le Phare) is very noisy until about 2am, so you don't want to be above it. On the plus side, they gave us earplugs... At ~$250 a night through Bookit.com, this is a lot more than you'd spend at many NOLA hotels, but I thought it was worth the added expense.

Reviews.Title: “great staff great managment great time”
Reviews.Author: farmer3229
Reviews.Content: i travel with my family a good deal and having teenage daughters can make travel the much more stressful but the staff at the hotel took wonderful care of us. i work in the resort industry and was highly impressed by the caliber of management. again kudos you guys are great!

Reviews.Title: “Very good place”
Reviews.Author: voyageher
Reviews.Content: Booked through bookit.com. the room was smelling like bleach. The very nice guy at the reception gave us another room and upgrade us to a bigger one, as we were asking for a bathtub. Great place to stay if you like modern architecture and if you don;t need a room service. Very quiet (away from the French quarter) and relaxing place. Didn't hear any noise from the trendy bar downstair (it was a Saturday night). Will definetely stay there again. The woman at the front desk in the morning was vry nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and trendy”
Reviews.Author: nf123
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW!! Loft 523 was amazing!! The rooms are extremely spacious with the most incredible bathrooms. I love taking baths so the extra large spoon tub was perfect. I can see why so many celebrities stay there being that it is a small hotel and even a little hidden with no sign out front. I truly felt like I was in my condo and not a hotel room. As for the lack of service I was worried about because of some of the reviews...I do not agree. The hotel only has 18 rooms so they have one concierge at the desk at all times... don't see why it needs anymore than that. Everything I needed and requested was delivered by asking the helpful concierge. During my stay I needed ice, dinner reservations, extra towels and assistance with my luggage. All of these requests were handled promptly with an extremely friendly and knowledgable staff. The hotel does not have a restaurant but you are in New Orleans with fabulous restaurants everywhere...trust me you will not go hungry. We even ordered in one day for lunch from their delivery menu book they had in the room. I would definitely recommend this hotel to hip trendy people looking for an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yoli24
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to comment on some of the hotel updates...although my friends and I were not able to stay over night at this hotel our time their was not that bad. We were able to check-in our hotel and get a room (the wrong room! our penthouse suite was being renovated due to plumbing problems so we were moved into a smaller room which would not accomodate 5 females and then moved to IH, the sister hotel) we did use the shower and toilet and had no problems (room 300) and the beds were great the front desk lady great, we really wanted to stay because it was very cozy, with a great bar and spacious hotel room just not enough bedding) Previous reviews stated construction with the lobby which is finished. Although the loft hotel and IH hotel use the same staff they are literally 2 minutes away in walking distance so its not a hassle to get assistance at anytime. A concierge came and got our luggage and moved our things between the hotels while we showered in the loft room and changed. As far as food, its new orleans who wants to eat hotel food in a great city like New Orleans...the hotel is located really close to bourbon so finding a great restaurant is not hard at all. The hotel is in the middle of everything Harrahs is to your right on Canal and Bourbon to the left on canal with great mini-shops and stores along the way. The hotel has wireless internet and the desk inside the rooms definitely come in handy for a laptop. Its very quiet and it only has like 15 rooms its great, check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Can't prove the reviews wrong”
Reviews.Author: jplayny
Reviews.Content: I must say, before I went to this hotel I thought some of the reviews were a bit harsh and fully expected I'd have a wonderful experience. I have to say now, most of the reviews are right on. The good: The rooms were generally good. Super comfy beds and well appointed furniture. We started off in a larger Superior room, but moved to a smaller room for a larger window and balcony. DON'T spend the extra money on the larger room, the standard size room is more than enough, and the bathroom was actually a little better. More Good: We were in NOLA for new year's, the same time as the Sugar Bowl. This hotel was extremely quiet and a nice break from all the craziness outside. The front desk staff were all helpful and really nice. There's also free internet access. The Bad: Just like others have said, service isn't so great. The staff is shared with the I Hotel, so there is no staff in the hotel except the front desk person. The housekeeping was subpar. An empty bottle of water was never removed from the nightstand for our whole stay (I know it's obnoxious but I left it just to see). All housekeeping did was make the bed and change the towels. Coffee and creamer weren't replaced, things weren't straightened up. More Bad: Like another reviewer, we had problems with our toilet which wasn't fixed. I actually had to go into the lobby to use the bathroom in the morning! There were also issues with our billing, and my husband ended up getting charged about 4 times. Overall: I would stay here again if my options were limited, but I'd be sure to ask for a room facing the front of the hotel with a balcony or large window. I do think it's overpriced - it's more expensive than I hotel and they actually have the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Should Have Read The Reviews”
Reviews.Author: dentalben
Reviews.Content: BTS (before the storm), we lived in NOLA for 6 years and have now replanted in Baton Rouge. We LOVE NOLA and every time we have an excuse to go down for a few days, we splurge: stay at a different hotel and eat at a new restaurant each time (with some old stand-bys too!)...WE USUALLY LOOK FOR THE BEST DEAL...But this time, decided to SPLURGE...and I FORGOT TO CHECK TRIP ADVISOR FOR REVIEW... Going off one friends mention of the hotel, we looked at it online and were suckered in...space, "loft", "spoon bath tub", luxury...AND THEY DELIVERED ON THAT...but what they don't have for a "5 star?" is service, amenities, positive attitude. If you want to do anything other than sit in your room (I know you don't go to NOLA to work out, but going to spa, gym would have been nice for at least one hour), you have to walk outside to ihotel (thought it was connected, my bad); The mini-bar had a decent little menu, just no items. the shower pressure was less than desired... had to ask multiple times for blanket... mattress H.A.R.D. LOTS OF ROOM THOUGH...B.I.G. ROOM. NOW: IF YOU WANT PRIVACY, THIS IS YOUR PLACE...there's only 5 rooms on the floor (we were on 4th so no noise from bar) and we never saw any other guests...were they there??? I've heard that "celebrities" stay at the PH, and i'm sure they get service... was it a horrible stay? no, have had worse, but not at 200/night. But won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: ssamuels99
Reviews.Content: While the hotel has nice rooms, the service was poor. My toliet did not work for 2 of my 3 night stay; the room was never clean; the balcony was dirty when I checked in and remained that way for the entire stay; and the soaps, etc were never replaced. Although I never complained, the hotel wanted to charge me for an extra night when I missed the 12pm check out by 5 min, even though the hotel was empty the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Loft 523 is a different but great option”
Reviews.Author: BooZoo
Reviews.Content: First of all, Loft 523 is on a non-descript block, with no signage or address. So be sure you know where you are going. The room was large, modern and comfortable. Concrete floors, 12 foot ceiling, floor to ceiling windows, huge bathroom with walk-in open shower, surround sound stereo/CD/DVD. Bed and linens were comfortable. Downsides: our room was lousy for hot water, and the bar downstairs is a "hip" nightclub, with loud dance music, and throngs of people spilling out of the club into the street. We were on the third floor, so no problem with noise. I would hate to get stuck on the second floor, though. This is definitely not a cookie-cutter chain hotel. Summer prices made this a fantastic bargain. Highly recommended for those looking for something different.

Reviews.Title: “An Unlofty Experience”
Reviews.Author: mardigas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in New Orleans, and this is the worst hotel experience I have suffered there in the post-Katrina age. To give the pluses, the room itself was incredible and the staff, although somewhat limited, was fairly friendly. Unfortunately, the charm ends there. The website gives the impression that it is connected to the Ihotel, but except for the staff, we saw no evidence of it. For ex\ample, we called the front desk on our first morning to order some coffee and breakfast. We were informed that they did not have room service. Needless to say, we were disappointed. The Loft bills itself as a cool and luxurious property. But they did not even offer a continental breakast that are offered at limited service hotels. Parking: The hotel charges $30.00 per night for valet parking, which is almost three times the amount charged by other hotels in the area. To make matters worse, they contract their valet service. When we called for our car on Saturday afternoon, we had to wait over 20 minutes for it to be brought to the hotel. Room Deficiencies: Our room came with a DVD player; however, there were no cables to connect the player to the television. When we talked to the front desk about it on Friday night, they assured us that we would have cables by the following day. Instead, they removed the player and did not provide a replacement. Also, the water temperature in the shower was tepid, and we could not adjust the position of the nozzles. Housekeeping: We left our room on Saturday morning at 10:00 in the morning, and retuned at 3:00. The room was not made. We wanted to rest before dinner, and asked the front desk to have housekeeping clean at 6:00. A few minutes later, the housekeeper called us on the phone and said that they had no housekeeping service after 6:00. Thus, we had o leave the room for 30 minutes while they serviced the room. NOISE: The hotel has a bar on the first floor. Despite the fact that the hotel was not near capacity, we were placed in a room just above the bar on the second floor. On both nights, we were kept awake by noise coming from revelers who were standing outside of the hotel after the bar closed. On both nights, we called the front desk to ask them to quiet the crowd. On both nights, we were told that there was nothing they could do about the situation. We considered writing a letter to the owners/managers of the hotel. But, we would not stay at The Loft again even if we were offered several free nights. I caution anyone coming to the New Orleans area to stay away from this sad joke for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ready for service?”
Reviews.Author: F12
Reviews.Content: I was a bit suspicious to not see any recent reviews or or press clipings regarding this exiting property in New Orleans, so I decided to give them a call before booking a reservation. Hotel is up and running, but still isn't 100% following the dreadful events of 2005. Front desk personel couldn't give specifics over the phone in regards to the overall condition of the hotel, but did say that things are still being worked out and are under repair. Overall, the information regarding the hotel's condition didn't sound too promising, so it would be unlikely that I would book a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: evillager
Reviews.Content: We were there pre-Katrina. Every hotel we stay in ever again will be judged against Loft 523. Rooms were amazing- what we would want our dream house to be. May not be your cup of tea if you don't appreciate minmalism or needs lots of "stuff" surrounding you. The bathroom was ridiculously HUGE and spa-like. Super clean. Not much of view, but we were happy to enjoy the view of the room itself. From start to finish everything is gorgeously designed and the service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Loft 523 We would return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Loft 523. We stayed there for Part Duex of our honeymoon. Both my husband and I really enjoyed our stay at this boutique hotel (only 18 rooms). Here are the Pros and then the very few Cons: Pros: The front desk people are all very accomodating and nice. We love the fact that this was an old warehouse turned into loft style rooms. We loved the high ceilings. We loved the furniture and decorations in the room. We loved that the maid left music playing after she was finished. We loved the bar. Very sleek and nice and on Friday nights it was jumpin'. We loved most of all, the spoon tub. If you stay here do yourself a favor and just upgrade for the experience of the tub. Cons: The walls were a bit thin and you could hear people down the halls. At night there was a very strange swishing sound. I have no idea what it was, but I had a hard time falling asleep sometimes because of it. Lastly, Magazine street in between Gravier and Canal has too many street people that would stop and try to swindle you for money. It is best to take Camp Street up to Canal to get to the French Quarter. Restaurants: Pat O's always a favorite same as Cafe Maspero and Pierre Maspero's. Sweet Ginger (thai) was excellent. The coconut shrimp is supreme. The Bourbon House was excellent as well. We also enjoyed Johnny's Poboys (all though we saw roaches on three different occasions, yuck!) It is hard to get a poor meal in this town. Overall, we will be back, we always come back to Nawlins

Reviews.Title: “God is in the Details”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loft 523 is a truly unique and well appointed hotel just a few minutes walk to the French Quarter. It is more New York minimal chic than New Orleans charm, but it turned out ot be a nice respite away from the rowdiness of Bourbon Street. Upon our early arrival we were greeted by a very friendly front desk clerk who gave us a great recommendation for lunch while our room was being made up. When we returned, we were surprised with a complimentary upgrade to one of the penthouse units and a bottle of Champagne on ice (I reserved the room on their website, and mentioned that we were there to celebrate our anniversary, so they obviously took note!). Our room was beatifully designed with very contemporary furniture in a calming palette of neutral colors and textures. The attached photos show the great "spoon" tub (for two!) and spacious open bathroom, as well as the generous sleeping and lounge areas of the main room.
